activities.loc: MDB Check Monitor & Posted Calendar for Courtroom

result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: and Order.  Granted.  Andrew Harrington appointed.  Repay $50.00 per month starting 12/02/2022. ***DIRECT PAY***
records.descr: Pet for appointment counsel,affidavit of indigency

records.addlTxt: Adjourned initial appearance on November 9, 2022 at 10:00 am.

11:01 AM Defendant Robyn D Sobolewski in court.  Prosecuting attorney Brady James Seidlitz in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
DE sworn. 
Blue form presented.
Court appoints Attorney Andrew Harrington to represent and orders repayment of $50 per month, beginning 12/2/22, by direct pay. 
Bond to continue.
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for November 9, 2022 at 10:00 am.

11:02 AM Defendant Robyn D Sobolewski appeared by video.  Prosecuting attorney Brady James Seidlitz in court for the State of Wisconsin.  DE relates she has attempted to contact private counsel numerous times, but has had no return call.
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for November 2, 2022 at 10:00 am.

Defendant shall be fingerprinted at the Barron County Sheriff's Dept., if not already done.
If represented by the Public Defender and does not have a phone, must contact the Public Defender weekly at 715-908-8473.

1:00 PM Defendant Robyn D Sobolewski appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Alex Kitto (for today) appeared by video for Robyn D Sobolewski.  Prosecuting attorney Brady James Seidlitz in court for the State of Wisconsin. 

1:01  Court relates and gives appearances.
Defendant must call the public defender's office to determine eligibility; call before leaving justice center.  If the defendant does not qualify for public defender representation, the defendant must complete a Petition for Appointment of an Attorney, Affidavit of Indigency also known as the blue form in order for the court to consider appointing an attorney (must be submitted before leaving justice center if she does not qualify for Public Defender services.

AIA set; must appear in person.

(Bond and MS scanned to jail)
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for September 28, 2022 at 10:00 am.
